course.subject: MECH
course.name: Design, Build and Test an Electrical Vehicle (EV)
course.description: Educational psychologist David Kolb has strongly advocated that experiential learning as "the process whereby knowledge is created through the transformation of experience". By taking this course the students will come to realise how theoretical knowledge can be applied to real engineering product design and manufacturing through experiencing all 4 stages of Kolb's experiential learning cycle. The core of the course will be taught by demonstrating how a scaled down EV is made and unfolding its design concepts one by one. For that, we will first design and build an EV before the course starts. This demo EV will be developed together with an experienced technician who will be helping to collect EV performance data, compile the BOM, and manufacture or outsource EV components, assemble the whole EV frame incorporating with an electromechanical motor system for transmission, test and debug the EV on the road. Instructor's approval is required.

reviews.author: Evil
reviews.comment_content:
***This course is not quite suitable for students with no mechanical engineering background (Year 1/2)***

Required 3D modeling using Solidworks.

This course focuses on the way how a typical design and manufacturing project is executed in industry. The importance of Voice of Customers (VOC), CTQ and how they can be cascaded down into the different improvement initiatives proposed by the students themselves. In the beginning of the course, a simple EV will be anatomized and explained in details what components are there in an EV and why and how each major component/ subassembly is made and functions. Based upon the VOC and design and manufacturing methodologies behind, each group of students (5-6 persons per group) will have to come up with a working EV based upon the groupâ€™s initiatives within the scope defined by VOC.
reviews.comment_teaching: Include lots of information in every lecture but with messy course schedule. The course is just like a more advanced MECH 2520 course.
reviews.comment_grading:
No scores would be released during and after the course for the log, reports and the presentation.

But as far as I know, everyone got at least a B range.
reviews.comment_workload:
You need to write several logs, two project report and a final project presentation.

You would need to spend most of your free time on the project.
Don't take this course if you are always busy or overloaded.
It's actually at least a 6 credit course.

reviews.author: Rubbish
reviews.title: Rubbish course ever
reviews.comment_content: The course is about the design and manufacture of the improvement on the EV. The lecture covers a lot of things such as material selection, fatigue and FEM but most of the content in lecture cannot used in this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is messy as it covers a lot of things and he planned to include several hundred pages of powerpoint in one lecture.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is not known for every student as he changed the grading criteria frequently and he assigned a lot of new things. I spent most of my time on this course but the grade was very bad.
reviews.comment_workload: You need to spend a lot of time and the workload is like a 5 credit course but the professor did not care and you need to go to lecture on Saturday if the professor wanted.
